content:
In ecology, a keystone species is a species that has a disproportionately large effect on its environment relative to its abundance. These species play a critical role in maintaining the structure of an ecological community, affecting many other organisms in the ecosystem and helping to determine the types and numbers of various other species in the community. Which of the following best describes the role of a keystone species in an ecosystem?
A. A keystone species is the most abundant species in an ecosystem.
B. A keystone species is a species that has no effect on its environment.
C. A keystone species plays a critical role in maintaining the structure of an ecological community.
D. A keystone species is a species that is not affected by other organisms in the ecosystem.
C. A keystone species plays a critical role in maintaining the structure of an ecological community.
